moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 Nd4: The Bird Defense, a very aggressive, if not perfectly sound, counter.
moves.5. Bc4: Pressuring KB7, a notorious weak spot.
moves.5... Nf6: Developing, and preventing a Q-and-B attack with Q-R5.
moves.6. e5: Trying to drive the Knight and allow Q-R5, followed by QxP mate.
moves.6... d5: The best defense. Now the quick mate idea is snuffed for good.
moves.7. Bb3: Still hoping to generate an attack on KB7. But now the initiative passes to Lange.
moves.7... Bg4: Suddenly Lange is the better developed, and after Anderssen's next move he will be quite cramped.
moves.8. f3: Blocking his Q, and the two Black QP's are squeezing Anderssen's Q-side.
moves.8... Ne4: A very sharp attacking move. With Anderssen's Q-side logjammed, Lange will try to use his superior mobility to smash the White defenses.
moves.9. O-O: Getting his K out of the center. However, the weakened diagonal from White's KN1-QR7 looks very dangerous [...P-Q6 opens the way for ...B-B4 ch, and the threat is looming.]
moves.10. fxg4: Anderssen tries to reduce the scale of the attacking force. However, his imprisoned Q-side pieces are virtually valueless.
moves.11... Ng3+: A brilliant reply, and probably the winning move.
moves.12... Qg5: The Queen draws a bead on the helpless White King.
moves.13... h5: A superb move. 14 RxQ would be countered by 14... PxP dis ch 15 R-R5 RxR mate.
moves.14... Qxf5: The Rook falls, and Lange's attack has lost none of its fury. The threat is now 15...QxP ch 16 QxQ RxQ mate.
moves.16. gxh5: White can do nothing to stop the attack.
moves.16... Qe4 17. Qf3: The last barricade. White's other pieces are frozen and cannot defend the exposed King.
moves.18. Qh3 Qe1+: Anderssen resigns. The curtain falls after 19 K-R2 B-N8 ch 20 K-R1 B-B6 dis ch 21 K-R2 Q-N7 mate.

opening: Ruy Lopez (C61), Bird's defence, Paulsen variation
